medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp pain in the right upper quadrant
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced nausea, vomiting, and anorexia for 2 days prior to admission. She awoke at 4 am with constant sharp pain in the right upper quadrant that does not go away. No fever, chills, night sweats, or diarrhea reported. Normal bowel movements with passing flatus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congestive Heart Failure (CHF), Tricuspid Regurgitation (TR), osteoporosis, compression fracture, Atrial Fibrillation (AFib), Hypertension (HTN), remote history of herpes zoster, chronic back pain, status post back surgery.
medical_history.family_history: Parents died due to cardiac related problems. Brother died of lung cancer.
